column4: but i want to pre download the packages on this computer for installing later when i don't have internet.. i am trying to swtich between wicd and network manager
but i want to pre download the packages on this computer for installing later when i don't have internet.. i am trying to swtich between wicd and network manager
so after you generate the download script, download it
make sure you just copy to /var/cache/apt/archives/ and then use APT or synaptic normally.  And make sure you are not mixing ubuntu versions
how do i know if i am mixing ubuntu versions
I mean just make sure both are hardy, or both are gutsy, etc.
thanks
how do i make sure after using the generation script it is in  /var/cache/apt/archives/
umm, you download a bunch of debs on one machine right?  Then when you copy them to the other machine, you put them in /var/cache/apt/archives/
oh ok i got it... so do wget ... put the packages into that folder and synaptics wont have  to d/l them they will already be there
do i have that correct?
yeah
yeah

thanks a ton i got it doone... what i am doing is doing it on the same computer.. just i want to install network manager .. go bacak and forth between them... but during using wicd i wont have internet connectivty to d/l network manager so it would hav eto be previously downloaded.. thats what i am trying to do.. and i think it should work fine now thaks to your help
I'd check out apt-zip for what you are doing.  It was intended for this sort of thing
hal is hot stuff!  what's wrong with your mouse?
all choppy upon movement  jrib
what mouse?
ps2 or usb?
it's a touchpad?

you're probably better off asking in the eee forums as I'm the problem is already addressed there.  You can check /var/log/Xorg.0.log to see how the touchpad is getting detected though.  And remember that input devices are ignored in xorg.conf now.  You need to use /etc/hal/fdi/policy/ to modify settings if you want
where are you looking?
